feature.name: Divine Domain: Mental Domain (HB)
feature.text:
The mind is a deep place, where enlightenment grows and confusion festers. There is a fine line between genius and insanity, and clerics of this domain specialize in both understanding and walking this line. While total submission to the senseless void of the mind is taboo in many places, most cultures also recognize the need for free flowing, intuitive, spontaneous aspects of life. Many cultures respect and even revere the formless chaos within, from which all ideas are birthed.
Mental Domain Spells Level | Spells 1st | dissonant whispers, Tasha's hideous laughter 3rd | phantasmal force, crown of madness 5th | fear, hypnotic pattern 7th | confusion, phantasmal killer 9th | modify memory, dominate person
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 11 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Bonus Proficiency (Mental Domain (HB))
feature.text:
You gain proficiency in the Insight, Intimidation, or Persuasion skill (your choice).
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 11 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Neuro Twinge (Mental Domain (HB))
feature.text:
1st-level Mental Domain feature When you damage a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher that deals psychic damage or requires a Wisdom saving throw, you can use your bonus action to deal an extra 1d10 psychic damage to that creature. Choose one creature if there are multiple. The psychic damage for this effect increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 11 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Mental Verge (Mental Domain (HB))
feature.text:
You can use your Channel Divinity to direct the sanity of a creature. As an action, you present your holy symbol and force one creature within 60 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you can affect the creature in one of the following ways:
Delusion. You inflict one random kind of indefinite madness.
Delirium. You inflict one random kind of long term madness.
Craze. You inflict one random kind of short term madness for 1d4 rounds.
Relief. You remove one kind of madness from the creature.
Other options may also be available, at your DM's discretion. If the effects are not apparent, the creature may not initially realize that anything has happened. Additionally, a creature may willingly fail the saving throw if it chooses to do so. If it does, you may select the specific kind of madness that is inflicted or removed.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Demented Retribution (Mental Domain (HB))
feature.text:
When you or a creature that you can see takes damage from another creature within 30 feet of you, you may use your reaction to cast phantasmal force-targeting the creature who dealt the damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus between long rests.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Inconceivable (Mental Domain (HB))
feature.text:
You have advantage on rolls to resist being charmed or frightened, and you can expend a use of your channel divinity as a bonus action to end the charmed or frightened condition on yourself or another creature within 60 feet of you. Additionally, others cannot detect or read your thoughts unless you allow them to.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Potent Casting (Mental Domain (HB))
feature.text:
You add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Power Over the Mind (Mental Domain (HB))
feature.text:
You can choose to be immune to environmental effects that would affect your mental or emotional state, such as the River Styx in Avernus or the regional effects of beholders, and you cannot be charmed or frightened. In addition, all creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw for your Mental Verge.
Source: Tasha's Scrapped Book p. 12 (Homebrew)
